Q1 2024.presentation_summary: Flutter Q1 2024: Revenue $3.54B (+20.5% YoY) driven by FanDuel US growth and international expansion. Loss of $150M primarily due to increased marketing spend and product development investments. FanDuel maintained #1 US market share with strong handle growth. Management highlighted continued investment in technology infrastructure and customer acquisition ahead of peak NFL season. PokerStars and SkyBet performed in line with expectations.

Q2 2024.presentation_summary: Flutter Q2 2024: Revenue $3.79B (+18.3% YoY) with strong profitability as earnings reached $580M (+45% YoY). FanDuel US continued market leadership with improved hold rates and customer engagement. International division showed steady growth across all regions. Management raised full-year guidance citing better-than-expected sportsbook margins and successful product launches. Focus on sustainable growth and margin expansion heading into H2.

Q3 2024.presentation_summary: Flutter Q3 2024: Revenue $3.25B (+27% YoY, beating estimates by 7%), EBITDA $650M (+75% YoY, exceeding estimates by 25%). FanDuel revenue $2.2B (+51% YoY), EBITDA $358M (vs $55M loss Q3 2023), holds 41% sportsbook GGR market share and 25% iGaming market share with 3.2M average monthly players (+28% YoY). Analysts questioned promotional expenses (up 540bps vs 400bps long-term guidance) and same-game parlay impact; CEO Jackson emphasized pricing accuracy driving differentiation, confirmed SGP drives significant hold improvement. Analysts probed Brazil regulatory timeline (Jan 1 launch preparation) and FanDuel market positioning. Preparing Missouri launch Q4, Alberta Q1 2026. Stock hit new 52-week high of $265.52, rising 7% post-earnings on strong FanDuel momentum and structural margin expansion.

Q4 2024.presentation_summary: Flutter Q4 2024: Revenue $3.79B (+14% YoY), net income $56M, EBITDA $655M (+4% YoY). FanDuel FY2024 revenue $9.8B, EBITDA $1.07B with #1 market position (43% sportsbook GGR share, 26% iGaming). Adverse NFL outcomes impacted Q4 revenue by ~$550M and EBITDA by ~$360M. Full year 2024 revenue $14B (vs $11.7B in 2023), EBITDA $2.3B (+26% YoY). Analysts questioned $90M investment losses in Missouri/Alberta expansion and customer acquisition environment; CEO Jackson noted larger-than-anticipated business end-state particularly in iGaming, with parlay offerings and structural hold improvements exceeding guidance. Brazil targeting $100M losses for year per CFO Coldrake. Announced FY2025 FanDuel guidance of $11.4-11.9B revenue, $1.3-1.5B EBITDA. Cost efficiency programs targeting $500M+ annualized savings by 2027. Stock reaction muted due to customer-friendly sports outcomes headwind.

Q1 2025.presentation_summary: Flutter Q1 2025: Net income and adjusted EBITDA growth of 289% and 20% YoY. US business driving step change in earnings with AMPs growing to 4.3M+. 2025 guidance: Revenue 7.08B midpoint, adjusted EBITDA .18B. Repurchased 891K shares for 30M in Q1, expecting ~B total shareholder returns in 2025. CEO Jackson: Scaling of US business driving step change in group earnings profile while international demonstrates benefits of scale/diversification with strong SEA and India performance. CFO Coldrake: SNAI included from May 1 with expected revenue 50M and EBITDA 90M; NSX from mid-May with expected revenue 20M and EBITDA loss 0M. Discussed economic resilience, noting historically economic softness hasn't significantly impacted business as consumers trade down but continue betting.

Q2 2025.presentation_summary: Flutter Q2 2025: Revenue .19B (+16% YoY) vs .13B expected, adjusted EBITDA 19M (+25%), EPS .95 vs estimated .08. ~16M average monthly players in Q2. CEO Jackson: Excellent operational performance with meaningful strategic progress. Maintained #1 US position in both Sportsbook and iGaming. Delivered largest Italy milestone with PokerStars migration to shared SEA platform. Well-positioned for content-rich NFL/NBA/European soccer calendars. CFO Coldrake: US revenues +17% (sportsbook +11%, iGaming +42%), US EBITDA 00M (00M above consensus). Raised 2025 guidance: Group revenue 7.26B, EBITDA .295B; US revenue .58B, EBITDA .245B. Revenue/EBITDA growth +23%/+40% at midpoint vs prior +22%/+35%. Repurchased 00M shares in Q2, B total expected in 2025, B planned over 3-4 years. Achieved 100% FanDuel ownership, reshaped US market access, integrated international assets. Cost transformation on track for 00M savings by 2027.

Q3 2025.presentation_summary: Flutter Q3 2025: EPS .64 vs forecast $.79 (107.59% beat), revenue .79B vs forecast .89B. 14M+ average monthly players, revenues +17% YoY, adjusted EBITDA +6%. Reported net loss 89M driven by 56M non-cash impairment (JungleE business India regulatory changes) and 05M payment for improved US market access terms with Boyd. Customer-friendly sports results Sept-Oct reduced full-year 2025 outlook by 80M adjusted EBITDA. CEO Jackson and CFO Coldrake led call Nov 12, 2025. Share repurchases: 25M Q3, 45M Q4, completing 2025 authorized program with total .12B cash return to shareholders since inception.

DraftKings Q3 2025: Revenue .14B (+4% YoY) despite customer-friendly sports outcomes impacting results by 00M+ in Sept-Oct. CEO Jason Robins stated this is 'the most bullish I've ever felt about the future of DraftKings' citing underlying business acceleration. Sportsbook handle up 10% YoY to 1.4B, iGaming revenue growth accelerated to 25% YoY. Company secured exclusive marketing deals with ESPN and NBCUniversal, expanded share buyback to B from B. Analysts focused on hold percentage recovery after customer-friendly outcomes; management emphasized business model strength and expectation for normalization over time.

Q2 2025.presentation_summary: DraftKings Q2 2025: Record revenue .51B (+37% YoY), record EBITDA 01M (doubled prior record). EPS $.38 beat forecast of $.13 by 192%. Sportsbook net revenue +45%, margins hit company record 8.7%, live betting handle +16%. Adjusted gross margin ~48% (+400bps YoY). Maintained FY2025 guidance of .2-6.4B revenue (toward high end) and 00-900M EBITDA (toward midpoint), incorporating Missouri launch and higher tax rates. CEO Robins emphasized conviction in reaching 30% EBITDA margin target over time. Favorable May/June outcomes added ~10M to revenue (may normalize). Highlighted cost optimization opportunities to offset IL/NJ/LA tax increases. Analysts discussed prediction markets TAM (too early to determine) and cost streamlining strategies including renegotiating older agreements and payment optimization.

Q1 2025.presentation_summary: DraftKings Q1 2025: Revenue .41B (+20% YoY) but missed forecast of .46B. EPS $.12 vs expected $.20. Adjusted EBITDA 03M. Sportsbook handle 3.9B (+16% YoY), structural hold 10.4% (+60bps YoY), adjusted gross margin 45% (+100bps YoY). Revised FY2025 guidance to .2-6.4B revenue and 00-900M EBITDA (down from prior). Live betting became major growth driver with handle exceeding 50% of total for first time. CEO Robins highlighted AI integration across company for efficiency gains in pricing, risk management, customer service. Customer-friendly March Madness outcomes negatively impacted results. Headwinds from Maryland tax increases and Texas/New Mexico digital lottery shutdowns. Despite earnings miss, stock rose 1.98% on strategic optimism.

Q4 2024.presentation_summary: DraftKings Q4 2024: Revenue $1.39B (in line with estimates), EPS $0.14 (beat $0.11 expected). Full year 2024 revenue $4.8B (+30% YoY), achieved positive free cash flow for first time while acquiring 3.5M new customers at record low CAC. Total customer base 10.1M (+42% YoY). Analysts questioned promotional intensity and handle growth slowdown; CEO Robins expects 'quite a decline in promotional intensity' in 2025 and attributed Q4 slowdown to one less NFL game and election distractions, with rapid acceleration post-election. Discussed prediction markets interest pending CFTC decisions. Raised FY2025 revenue guidance low end to $6.3-6.6B (from $6.2-6.6B). Stock traded higher on bottom-line beat and raised guidance, targeting 30% EBITDA margins over time.

Q3 2024.presentation_summary: DraftKings Q3 2024: Revenue $1.10B (+39% YoY), EBITDA loss $59M. Online sportsbook GGR +39%, iGaming +26%, new customer acquisition +14% with CAC down 20% YoY. NFL parlay mix increased 500bps driven by product improvements and marketing. Analysts questioned Illinois tax strategy and prediction markets potential; CEO Robins highlighted opportunities in non-sports betting markets ahead of next presidential election. Revised FY2024 guidance to $4.85-4.95B revenue (from $5.05-5.25B) due to customer-friendly Q4 sports outcomes. Introduced FY2025 guidance of $6.2-6.6B revenue (+31% YoY). Stock declined 6% in extended trading on wider-than-expected loss and lowered guidance, despite maintaining Strong Buy consensus with $49.08 average price target (+26% upside).

Q2 2024.presentation_summary: DraftKings Q2 2024: Revenue $1.1B (+26% YoY) with significantly improved profitability as loss narrowed to $64M (+80% improvement YoY). Strong customer retention and operating leverage drove margin expansion. Sportsbook hold rates normalized following customer-friendly Q1 outcomes. Management raised full-year guidance citing better unit economics and market expansion opportunities. Focus on profitability and sustainable growth ahead of NFL season.

Q1 2024.presentation_summary: DraftKings Q1 2024: Revenue $1.23B (+42% YoY) reflecting strong customer acquisition and market share gains. Loss of $310M primarily from customer acquisition costs and state launches. Active user base grew 35% YoY with improved customer lifetime value metrics. Management highlighted successful NFL playoffs performance and preparation for March Madness. Maintained full-year revenue guidance of $4.8-5.0B with path to profitability in 2024.

MGM Resorts Q1 2024: Revenue $4.12B (+9% YoY) with earnings of $480M (+12% YoY). Las Vegas Strip properties showed strong performance with improved RevPAR and convention activity. Regional portfolio contributed steady cash flow. BetMGM continued market share growth in sports betting and iGaming. Management highlighted successful March Madness performance and strong F&B revenue. Focus on margin expansion and Macau recovery trajectory.

Q2 2024.presentation_summary: MGM Resorts Q2 2024: Revenue $4.33B (+10% YoY) with strong earnings of $610M (+19% YoY). Las Vegas Strip showed robust leisure and convention demand with premium segment strength. Regional properties maintained solid performance. BetMGM approached profitability with improved unit economics. Macau operations continued recovery with strong VIP and mass market growth. Management optimistic about H2 convention calendar and Formula 1 impact.

Q3 2024.presentation_summary: MGM Q3 2024: Record consolidated net revenues with Las Vegas revenue +1%, EBITDA +2% YoY. Generated 04M free cash flow through 9 months (.7B operating cash flow, 50M CapEx). Record Las Vegas ADR (+3%), occupancy +250bps, slot handle +4%. Excluding high-end baccarat, gross profit from other segments +12%. Regional revenue +3%, EBITDA +2% YoY. MGM China revenue +14% YoY, EBITDA +5% with 26% margin and 15% market share, paid 00M in dividends to MGM. BetMGM achieved profitability with +70% first-time depositors, +20% GGR. CEO Hornbuckle called 2024 an 'investment year' for BetMGM with Brazil partnership. Exited NY casino bid citing compressed returns. Analysts discussed digital business value unlock potential.

Q4 2024.presentation_summary: MGM Q4 2024: Revenue .3B vs forecast .28B, EPS $.45 beat forecast of $.39. Full-year record consolidated revenues driven by MGM China. CEO Hornbuckle emphasized best full-year revenues in company history with continued Bellagio improvements and Delano Tower rebranded to W Las Vegas. CFO Halkyard reported .4B consolidated adjusted EBITDA for 2024. Repurchased 33M shares in 2024 totaling .4B. Marriott partnership exceeded expectations with 660K room nights. December bookings were 43% higher than prior record month. BetMGM net revenues exceeded B with 2025 guidance of .4-2.5B. Stock surged 10.79% in aftermarket to 8.08.

Q1 2025.presentation_summary: MGM Q1 2025: Net income 49M vs 17M prior year. Consolidated Adjusted EBITDA 37M vs 73M prior year. Beat EPS expectations with $.69 vs forecast $.50. CEO Hornbuckle remained optimistic despite declines, noting April was on track for record hotel month for Vegas Strip. BetMGM reported positive EBITDA of 2M, significant improvement from prior year, driven by iGaming and strategic customer acquisition. MGM-Marriott collaboration exceeded expectations, slated for 900K room nights in 2025 vs 660K in 2024. MGM implementing 00M EBITDA improvement plan with potential for 50M+ in 2025. CFO Halkyard: Repurchased 15M shares for 94M in Q1. Japan project equity commitment .96B with 92B yen remaining, on time for 2030 opening.

Q2 2025.presentation_summary: MGM Q2 2025: Record consolidated net revenue .4B vs anticipated .31B. EPS $.79 exceeded forecast $.55, marking surprise of 43.64%. Consolidated adjusted EBITDA ~50M. CEO Hornbuckle: Operational scale and diversity delivered solid growth driven by accelerating EBITDA growth at BetMGM and record results from Regional Operations and MGM China. Las Vegas experienced choppy period with adjusted EBITDAR decline due to MGM Grand disruptions and midweek weakness. Luxury offerings like Bellagio saw ADR +4%, high-end play +25% YTD. MGM China achieved record adjusted EBITDAR with 16.6% market share. BetMGM raised full-year 2025 guidance, indicating EBITDA turnaround of nearly 00M vs last year. CFO Halkyard: Bonus depreciation leading to 00M tax refund forecast in 2025. MGM China dividend policy of 50% distributable net income, estimated 50-200M annually.

Q3 2025.presentation_summary: MGM Q3 2025: Net revenue .3B topped forecast .2B but EPS $.24 fell short of $.37 target (down from $.54 YoY). Las Vegas EBITDAR 01M, down 30M YoY: 7M decrease in business interruption proceeds, 5M MGM Grand renovation disruption, 8M operational impacts (primarily ADRs). Vegas net revenue declined 7%. Sold Northfield Park for 46M cash (acquired 2019 for 75M), sale multiple 6.6x vs MGM trading at <3x. CFO Halkyard: MGM Digital revenue +23%, segment EBITDAR loss 3M with full-year losses potentially 00M due to Brazil investment. BetMGM now cash generative, set to return 00M in Q4. Capital allocation: Given share price, internal free cash yield estimates 25-30%. Over 90% of 50M cost-saving actions complete. Japan IR Project all elements under construction, 00M yen credit facility closed at ~2.5%. CEO Hornbuckle: Conditions improved since July, October potentially surpassing last year.

Q1 2024.presentation_summary: Caesars Entertainment Q1 2024: Revenue $2.82B (+5% YoY) with earnings of $130M (-15% YoY reflecting increased promotional activity). Las Vegas segment showed mixed results with softer leisure demand but strong convention business. Regional properties delivered consistent performance. Caesars Sportsbook continued market share battles with elevated marketing spend. Management focused on debt reduction and operational efficiency initiatives. Digital margins under pressure from competitive landscape.

Q2 2024.presentation_summary: Caesars Entertainment Q2 2024: Revenue $2.95B (+8% YoY) with improved earnings of $225M (+9% YoY). Las Vegas segment benefited from strong summer visitation and event calendar. Regional casinos showed stable performance with improved operating margins. Caesars Sportsbook focused on profitable growth with reduced promotional intensity. Management highlighted successful debt refinancing and progress on digital profitability targets. Optimistic about H2 event calendar including NFL season.

Q3 2024.presentation_summary: Caesars Q3 2024: Same-store net revenue .9B, EBITDA B with 35% margins (flat YoY). Las Vegas net revenue B, EBITDA 72M (-2% YoY) with record non-gaming performance (97.1% occupancy, strong ADRs). Regional EBITDA 98M (-13% YoY) impacted by competitive pressures and New Orleans construction disruption. Caesars Digital delivered record EBITDA of 2M (vs M YoY) on revenue of 03M (+41% YoY). iGaming revenue +83% YoY, sports betting +36% with 8.6% hold. Completed 35M Caesars New Orleans renovation. Executed .1B senior unsecured bond issuance improving financial flexibility. CEO Reeg discussed non-core asset sales (75-500M range). Digital President Hession noted strong early Horseshoe launch performance.

Q4 2024.presentation_summary: Caesars Q4 2024: Beat EPS expectations with $.05 vs -$.15 expected. Digital segment set all-time records: FY2024 net revenue .2B (+20% YoY), EBITDA 17M (vs 8M in 2023). Q4 digital revenue 03M, EBITDA 0M (low hold cost ~7M in revenue, ~0M in EBITDA). Regional net revenue -1%, EBITDA -5% YoY but improved sequentially vs Q2/Q3. Completed Caesars New Orleans remodel Oct 22, opened Danville VA permanent facility Dec 17. 2025 outlook: regional EBITDA flat to slightly up, continued digital growth, ~B free cash flow projected with B total outflows. Q1 2025: Consolidated EBITDA +4% YoY driven by Digital segment delivering new Q1 record and Regional growth.

Q1 2025.presentation_summary: Caesars Q1 2025: Consolidated Net Revenues .8B (+2% YoY), Total Adjusted EBITDA 84M (+4% YoY). CEO Tom Reeg, President/COO Anthony Carano, CFO Bret Yunker, Digital President Eric Hession led call April 29, 2025. Las Vegas Same-Store Adjusted EBITDAR 33M (flat YoY) with EBITDA Margins 43.2% (+50bps YoY). Regional Adjusted EBITDAR 40M (+2% YoY). Caesars Digital Net Revenue 35M (+19% YoY), Adjusted EBITDA 3M (+8M YoY).

Q2 2025.presentation_summary: Caesars Q2 2025: Consolidated net revenues .9B, adjusted EBITDA 55M. Digital achieved record quarter: 0M adjusted EBITDA, iGaming net revenue +51% YoY, Digital Adjusted EBITDA Margin +880bps to 23.3%, Sports +28% and Casino +51% YoY. CEO Reeg forecasted continued Las Vegas softness into Q3 2025 but emphasized group bookings stabilize/strengthen outlook from Q4 into 2026. Vegas occupancy dropped to 97% from 99% prior year. Regional Q2 negatively affected by 0M in one-time items but expected flat/positive EBITDA for full year 2025. Fully redeemed most expensive debt, resulting in 0M+ annual free cash flow savings. Reeg indicated digital separation transaction will be considered if it 'would drive significant value to shareholders,' with preparations aligning to achievement of financial targets in first half 2026. Targeting 00M+ digital EBITDA by 2026.

Q3 2025.presentation_summary: Caesars Q3 2025: Net revenue .9B, adjusted EBITDA 84M, hold-normalized EBITDA 27M. Las Vegas same-store adjusted EBITDA 79M, hold-normalized 98M. Vegas results driven by 92% occupancy vs 97% last year, ADR -5% due to city-wide visitation weakness. Trends improved sequentially through quarter, September delivered strongest results. On track for record EBITDA year in 2025 with strong Q4 booking pace and group mix increasing to 17%. Regional Adjusted EBITDA 06M, hold-normalized 17M, Net Revenue Growth +6% YoY. Regional revenues up YoY driven by strong Danville and New Orleans returns, EBITDA +4% hold-normalized. Digital net revenue 11M, adjusted EBITDA 8M, hold-normalized 0M. Monthly Unique Payers +15% to 460K. Repurchased 00M during quarter, totaling 00M since mid-2024. Redeemed 46M senior notes during quarter. Call held Oct 28, 2025 with CEO Reeg, President/COO Carano, CFO Yunker, Digital President Hession.

Q1 2024.presentation_summary: Penn Entertainment Q1 2024: Revenue $1.56B (+2% YoY) with loss of $95M due to ESPN Bet launch costs and marketing investments. Regional casino portfolio showed resilient performance despite softer consumer spending. ESPN Bet integration progressing with customer acquisition ramping. Management emphasized long-term value of ESPN partnership while acknowledging near-term profitability pressure. Focus on database monetization and operational efficiency across retail footprint.

Q2 2024.presentation_summary: Penn Entertainment Q2 2024: Revenue $1.62B (+4% YoY) with modest earnings of $45M (-63% YoY) as ESPN Bet costs persisted. Regional properties maintained stable performance with selective promotional discipline. ESPN Bet customer acquisition continued but at lower ROI than expected. Management announced strategic review of digital operations and cost structure optimization. Concerns emerging about ESPN Bet partnership economics and competitive positioning in key states.

Q3 2024.presentation_summary: Penn Q3 2024: Revenue .4B, retail EBITDA 72M. Interactive segment saw 127% YoY growth in monthly active users to nearly 4M members, OSB NGR +200% YoY driven by higher parlay mix and lower promos. Interactive EBITDA loss 1M. Unveiled 7 new ESPN BET branded retail sportsbooks. CEO Snowden emphasized ESPN BET's casual mass market focus and improving monetization. Standalone Hollywood iCasino app launching to leverage cross-sell with land-based casinos targeting slot players. Q4 retail EBITDA guidance 40-460M, 2024 CapEx ~00M. Rough Q4 start due to low hold percentages. CTO LaBerge reported tens of thousands of ESPN-ESPN BET account links showing higher engagement. Facing new competition in Nebraska, Louisiana, Chicagoland markets.

Q4 2024.presentation_summary: Penn Q4 2024: Retail revenue .4B, adjusted EBITDA 61M both above guidance. Properties not impacted by new supply generated ~3% YoY revenue growth. Interactive adjusted revenues 42M, EBITDA loss 09.8M. Customer-friendly sports betting results negatively impacted interactive revenues by 4M and EBITDA by 2M. Total CapEx 21M for Q4. CEO Snowden joined by CFO Felicia Hendrix. 2025 Guidance: Retail revenue .6-5.75B, EBITDAR .85-1.95B. Interactive revenue .25-1.75B, EBITDA loss 00-100M. Total CapEx 30M. Company anticipates free cash flow positive in 2025 and beyond, approaching slight profitability in interactive segment by year-end 2025. No significant new competitive supply anticipated in 2025 or 2026 beyond known markets.

Q1 2025.presentation_summary: Penn Q1 2025: Missed earnings forecasts. Retail Revenue .4B, Adjusted EBITDA 57M with 33.1% margins. Cash and equivalents 92M, total liquidity .5B. Weather-related disruptions affected EBITDAR by 0M in Q1. CEO Snowden and CFO Hendrix led call. Interactive segment targeting positive EBITDA by Q4 2025 and full profitability in 2026. CEO: 'Nearing an inflection point and anticipate each quarter of 2025 to deliver a lower loss sequentially.' Plans to expand digital offerings through ESPN partnership. Retail strength: Pennsylvania theoretical play +21%, Michigan +27% YoY in Q1. Online theoretical play +165% Pennsylvania, +242% Michigan.

Q2 2025.presentation_summary: Penn Q2 2025: Beat earnings expectations. Retail revenue .4B, adjusted EBITDA 90M with nearly 34% margins. Revenue growth 4% YoY in markets not impacted by new supply. Interactive segment achieved record quarterly gaming revenue in both OSB and iCasino with significant YoY improvements. Omnichannel: Online-to-retail player count +8%, online-to-retail theoretical revenue +28% YoY. CEO Snowden: 'Having both retail and digital relationship with your consumers is clearly a major key to success for the industry.' CFO Hendrix: 'Diverse portfolio of retail properties delivered another solid quarter, particularly in markets not impacted by new supply.' 2026 cash taxes lower by 0M in each of 2026 and 2027. Q3 2025 guidance: Interactive revenue 95-335M. No cash tax liability expected in 2025. Aims for interactive segment profitability by 2026.

Q3 2025.presentation_summary: Penn Q3 2025: EPS -$.22 missed forecast -$.05, revenue .4B vs anticipated .73B. Despite miss, stock rose 9.48% pre-market to 7.90. Retail revenue .4B with 32.8% EBITDA margins. Interactive segment EBITDA loss 6.6M, gaming revenues and EBITDA below expectations due to customer-friendly hold and lower OSB volumes. iCasino achieved highest quarterly gaming revenue to date. Major announcement: Terminating ESPN Bet partnership, shifting focus to theScore Bet. New share repurchase authorization 50M. In Q3 repurchased 54.1M shares at avg 9.34/share. Targeting break-even or better in interactive segment by 2026. Retail faced increased competition and promotional activity, leading to higher marketing/labor costs in markets with new competition. Q4 anticipates interactive segment loss influenced by one-time brand transition and retention expenses.

Q1 2024.presentation_summary: Rush Street Interactive Q1 2024: Revenue $242M (+15% YoY) driven by strong US and LatAm growth. Small loss of $12M reflected investment in market expansion and product development. BetRivers showed solid performance in established markets with improving customer economics. Colombia operations ramped successfully with strong player engagement. Management highlighted disciplined marketing approach and focus on sustainable growth. Positive outlook for Q2 with improving unit economics.

Q2 2024.presentation_summary: Rush Street Interactive Q2 2024: Revenue $258M (+19% YoY) with return to profitability at $8M earnings (+181% improvement YoY). US operations showed strong margin expansion with disciplined customer acquisition. LatAm continued rapid growth with Colombia leading the way. BetRivers maintained competitive position without excessive promotional spend. Management raised full-year guidance citing better-than-expected operating leverage and market conditions. Focus on profitable growth and selective market expansion.

Q3 2024.presentation_summary: Rush Street Interactive Q3 2024: Record revenue 32M (+37% YoY), EBITDA 3M (+5x YoY) marking 15th consecutive quarterly revenue increase since IPO. CEO Schwartz credited high-value player attraction/retention and innovative products. Launched PropPacks combining sports cards excitement with prop bets for NBA games. Updated 2024 guidance: revenue +3%, EBITDA +24% (110% above initial expectations). Analysts questioned Q4 margin compression (marketing spend, Colombia VAT), Colombia tax reform outlook (Schwartz expects normal conditions to resume), increased football season promotions, and new payment partnerships improving user experience and future cost efficiencies.

Q4 2024.presentation_summary: RSI Q4 2024: EPS $.07 vs forecast $.05, revenue 54.2M vs anticipated 43.83M. Q4 revenue +31% YoY, adjusted EBITDA up 2.5x from prior year. Full year 2024 revenue 24.1M (+34% YoY), gross margin expanded 200+bps, marketing expenses reduced, adjusted EBITDA up 11x YoY. North America online +29%, Latin America +54%. US/Canada MAUs ~205K (+28% YoY), LatAm MAUs 348K (+71% YoY). CEO Schwartz: 'Not only set records in revenue, profitability, cash flow, margins, user accounts and many other key KPIs.' CFO Sauers: Disciplined marketing approach, 'spending more in markets where we see better opportunity for returns.' 2025 guidance: Revenue ,010-1,080M (midpoint +13% growth), adjusted EBITDA 15-135M (midpoint +35%).

Q1 2025.presentation_summary: RSI Q1 2025: Revenue 62M (+21% YoY), EPS $.09 vs forecast $.07. Adjusted EBITDA 3M nearly doubled from prior year. Online casino +25%, sports betting +11%. North America MAUs +17% YoY, Latin America MAUs +61%. Cash position 28M, no debt. Colombia VAT tax (19%) negatively impacted growth with net revenue flat YoY in April despite 55% GGR increase. CFO Sowers: 'Removal of VAT tax would be meaningful driver of growth.' Full-year 2025 guidance: Revenue .1-1.8B (midpoint +13% YoY), adjusted EBITDA 15-135M.

Q2 2025.presentation_summary: RSI Q2 2025: EPS $.11 vs forecast $.06 (+83.33%), revenue 69M vs anticipated 49.65M. Record quarterly net income 8.8M vs loss in Q2 2024, Adjusted EBITDA 0.2M (+88% YoY). CEO Schwartz: 'Delivered another record quarter across the board.' Strategic focus on online casino markets driving exceptional performance. MAUs: US/Canada 197K (+21%), LatAm 403K (+42%). On prediction markets: If leads to tax erosion, could accelerate online casino legalization benefiting RSI. Mexico expected to be one of largest LatAm markets. CFO Sauers: Guidance includes full Illinois/New Jersey tax changes impact and Colombia VAT through year-end. Colombia VAT lift expected to provide immediate revenue/margin uplift. 2025 guidance: Revenue .050-1.100B (+16% YoY), adjusted EBITDA 33-147M (+51%).

Q3 2025.presentation_summary: RSI Q3 2025: Revenue 77.9M (+20% YoY), net income 4.8M, Adjusted EBITDA 6.0M (+54% YoY). Total US/Canada MAUs ~225K (+34% YoY), online casino markets +46% YoY. LatAm MAUs ~415K (+30% YoY). ARPMAU 65 US/Canada, 7 LatAm. Raised full-year 2025 guidance: Revenue .10-1.12B (midpoint .11B, +20% YoY), Adjusted EBITDA 47-153M (midpoint 50M, +62% YoY). Leadership changes: Kyle Sauers promoted to President and CFO, expanding role to oversee marketing, operations, commercial strategy beyond finance. Rob Picard elevated to Chief Strategy Officer. CEO Schwartz highlighted sweepstakes operators presenting challenge/opportunity, believes states should legalize/regulate online casino. Sauers noted Mexico gaming tax likely rising 30% to 50% but ways to reduce effective rate.

Q1 2024.presentation_summary: Bally's Corporation Q1 2024: Revenue $598M (+3% YoY) with loss of $48M reflecting integration costs from Queen Casino acquisition. Regional casino properties showed mixed performance with some markets under pressure from consumer spending headwinds. Interactive segment growth offset by elevated customer acquisition costs. Management focused on integration synergies and cost optimization across combined portfolio. NYC casino license bid preparation underway.

Q2 2024.presentation_summary: Bally's Corporation Q2 2024: Revenue $622M (+5% YoY) with loss of $60M due to continued integration expenses and competitive pressures. Regional properties faced headwinds from economic uncertainty and competition. Interactive division showed growth but margins compressed. Management announced strategic initiatives to improve operational efficiency and reduce debt. Focus on NYC casino license opportunity and portfolio optimization. Integration of Queen Casino properties progressing but slower than anticipated.

Q3 2024.presentation_summary: Bally's Q3 2024: Revenue 30M (-0.8% YoY), missed EPS expectations with -.99 vs -$.25 expected. North America Interactive revenue 5.7M (+54.5% YoY) with EBITDAR loss 1M. International Interactive margins improved ~400bps. Cash 91M, long-term debt .7B. Chicago development progressing with 40M GLPI funding commitment, targeting Sept 2026 opening (3,300 slots, 170+ tables, 500-room hotel, 3,000-seat theater). Rhode Island operations impacted by I-195 bridge disruption headwinds affecting Lincoln property. No Q&A session due to Casino Queen merger shareholder proxy process (Special Meeting scheduled Nov 19).

Q4 2024.presentation_summary: Bally's Q4 2024: Company-wide revenue 80.4M (-5.1% YoY). Casinos & Resorts revenue 24.4M (-5.2% YoY). UK online revenue +11.3%, overall International Interactive revenue 14.5M (-9.1% YoY). North America Interactive revenue 1.5M (+24.4% YoY). Cancelled Q4 2024 earnings call previously scheduled March 5, 2025 but released financial results. CEO Reeves: 'Fiscal 2024 was transformational and transitional year as we funded and began development of permanent Chicago casino resort and completed controlled demolition of Tropicana in Las Vegas.' CFO Glover: Team working to optimize cost structure, enhance operational efficiency, adopt Queen best practices, set stage for long-term value creation. President Papanier: Received final Chicago City approval for re-imagined Bally's Chicago Casino master plan in December, completed demolition and began construction.

Q2 2025.presentation_summary: Bally's Q2 2025: Revenue 57.5M (+6% YoY), net loss 28.4M vs 0.2M Q2 2024. Adjusted EBITDA 29.2M (nearly flat YoY). Casinos & Resorts revenue 93.3M (+14.7% YoY) from four Queen regional gaming properties addition. International Interactive 06.1M. North America Interactive 6.5M (+21.5% YoY) supported by iGaming and sports betting expansion. CEO Reeves: 'Q2 results reflect milestone achievements and marked progress on business transformation as new Bally's 2.0. While domestic regional gaming environment remained stable, mindful of economic challenges consumers face. Team focused on effective marketing strategies, cost management, continuing Bally's 2.0 initiatives and integrating Bally's/Queen best practices.' Entered transaction agreement to sell International Interactive to Intralot S.A. for €2.7B, expected Q4 2025 close, making Bally's majority Intralot shareholder. Permanent Chicago casino expected 2026 opening with 40M GLPI funding secured.

Q3 2025.presentation_summary: Bally's Q3 2025: Revenue 63.7M (+5.4% YoY) vs 32.5M analyst estimate. Casinos & Resorts revenue 96.1M (+12.1% YoY), Adjusted EBITDAR 07.9M (+7.4% YoY) driven by four Queen regional gaming properties integration. North America Interactive revenue 9.9M (+13.1% YoY) reflecting growing digital momentum. International Interactive revenue 15.1M (-6.9% YoY) solely from Bally's Asia divestiture in 2024; UK online revenue +8.0% (+4.2% constant currency) from strong player monetization. CEO Reeves: 'Solid Q3 results mark further marked progress on transformation to new Bally's 2.0.' Major developments: Intralot S.A. completed acquisition of Bally's International Interactive for €2.7B (€1.530B cash + 873.7M new Intralot shares giving Bally's 58% ownership). Allocated ~.3B cash proceeds to pay down secured debt and revolver balances. Chicago construction 'in full swing' on .7B project. Submitted B Bronx casino proposal (largest private investment in borough history), one of three remaining applicants for up to three downstate NY gaming licenses. Announced Bally's Las Vegas development on former Tropicana site, sharing 35-acre campus with Las Vegas Athletics stadium. CFO Mira Mircheva (25+ years finance experience, former Queen CFO). Launched cost-reduction initiatives projected 5M+ annual savings starting current quarter. Strong performance at Vicksburg, Kansas City, Queen Baton Rouge properties.
